Contradict fact: The claim contradicts official sources and statistics on interracial homicides and killings by police.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the percentage of white homicide victims killed by blacks.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by relying on inaccurate and unsupported statistics.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as the statistics cited are not backed by official sources.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption by presenting racially loaded and incorrect murder statistics.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no evidence of an alternative explanation in the claim.
